result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jillisha M Shepard

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jillisha M Shepard not in court.  Attorney Nicholas John Conrardy appeared by video for Jillisha M Shepard.  Prosecuting attorney Josh Milder in court for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
Matter scheduled for Pretrial Conference.  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed the issuance until the next court date. Case adjourned, Br. 41.
Calendar call scheduled for November 14, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Jillisha M Shepard appeared by video.  Attorney Nicholas John Conrardy appeared by video for Jillisha M Shepard.  Prosecuting attorney Elaine B. Fehrs appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
OFF THE RECORD: Pretrial Conference held. Due to Court congestion, Court is unable to hear case.  Parties emailed new court date.  Case adjourned, Br. 41.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 13, 2022 at 08:30 am.

No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms. 
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 5:00 P.M. ON 09-08-2022. IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR, A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with DLW. 
No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Defendant Jillisha M Shepard in court.  Prosecuting attorney Foley J. Van Lieshout Ms. in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Skwierawski, Branch 41.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant IS Public Defender eligible. Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  
The case is adjourned to Br. 41 for a Pretrial Conference.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 26, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Jillisha M Shepard
Current: 552 N 29th St., Milwaukee, WI 53208 United States  (Effective: 05-25-2022)
Prior: 11121 West North Avenue, Milwaukee, WI 53209
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
